pageContext.description:
A fragment of a cast copper alloy probable palstave axe dating to the Middle Bronze age. . The axe is sub-rectangular in profile and is 14.92 mm wide at the break. The body of the axehead has a sub-rectangular cross section. The body flares to an expanded, asymmetrical, crescentic cutting edge. The axe has a dark green patina with patches of a lighter green along the edge of the blade. At the break there is an area of reddish, copper-rich corrosion.

Date: Middle Bronze Age - c. 1600 - 1000 BC

Dimensions: 40.51 mm x 17.56 mm x 15.11 mm

Weight: 55.98 g



Similar to a fragment described in record SUSS-CC1CE5 on the database
